intro: Pedicularis lasiophrys, commonly known as the hairy beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright red or orange flowers that are typically clustered at the top of the stem. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Pedicularis lasiophrys is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
